description: Richard Conniff is a contributing writer for The Opinion Pages. He writes about behavior of creatures on two, four, six and eight legs, as well as the occasional slither. His books include “The Natural History of the Rich” (2002), “Swimming With Piranhas at Feeding Time” (2009) and “The Species Seekers” (2010). His writing has appeared in many magazines, earning a National Magazine Award, a Guggenheim Fellowship and other honors. He has been a radio commentator on NPR’s Marketplace, and has written and presented television shows for the National Geographic Channel, TBS and the BBC.

Contributing Op-Ed Writer
Selling the Protected Area Myth
Designating protected areas is relatively easy, but hardly anyone seems to be bothering with the hard work of actually protecting them.
